statement.p: How many significant digits does 203 have?
How many significant digits does 20\bar{0}0 have?

solution.p: Because 203 ends with a non-zero digit all three digits are significant.
Because the 0 in the tens position is marked as significant (the bar) there are 3 significant digits

statement.p: There are 32 students in a class. Below are percents for each racial group tracked. Calculate the number of students in each group.

solution.p: In this class there are 0.0625 \cdot 32 = 2 Alaska Native students; 0.125 \cdot 32 = 4 Asian students; 2 Black students (same percent as Alaska Native); 0.7188 \cdot 23 \approx 23.0016 or 23 White students; and 0.0938 \cdot 32 \approx 3.0016 or 3 students who declared as other.

statement.p: What is the percent increase or decrease if enrollment in a class was 57 in spring and 81 in fall?

solution.p: The ratio is \frac{81}{57} \approx 1.42\text{.} Because 81 is greater than 57 this is a percent increase. The increase is 42%.

statement.p: What is the percent increase or decrease if enrollment in a class was 78 in fall and 38 in spring?

solution.p: The ratio is \frac{38}{78} \approx 0.49\text{.} Because 38 is greater than 78 this is a percent decrease. Because the new is 49% of the previous the decrease is 100%-49%=51%.

statement.p: Suppose one container has a solution that is 11% alcohol and another container has a solution that is 4\bar{0}\%\text{.} Both are percent by volume. If 4.0 oz of the first is mixed with 1.0 oz of the second what is the percent alcohol by volume?

solution.p: We know we will end up with 5.0 oz total. We calculate the volume of alcohol in the first to be 0.11 \cdot 4.0 = 0.44 and the volume alcohol in the second to be 0.40 \cdot 1.0 = 0.40\text{.} Thus the alcohol part is 0.44+0.40=0.84\text{.} The percent alcohol by volume of the result is P/T = 0.84/5.0 = 0.17 or 17%.

statement.p: Calculate how far a plane flying at a rate of 110 nm/hour would travel in 3.1 hours
One formulation of amoxicillin, a drug used to treat infections in infants, contains 125 mg of amoxicillin per 5.00 mL of liquid. How much amoxicillin is in 12.0 mL of liquid?
Look up the conversion from kilometers to miles. How many miles per hour is 12 kilometers per hour?

Note that a pound (lb) is a unit of force. It is approximately equal to 4.45 Newtons which is another unit of force. How many Newtons per square meter is 51.2 lbs per square inch? Look up other conversions as needed.
If the Diamond DA-20 climbs at the rate of
how long will it take it to climb 2500 ft?

p.me: \begin{aligned} \frac{450 \; \text{ft}}{1.0 \; \text{minute}} \amp = \frac{2500 \; \text{ft}}{t \; \text{minutes}}.\\ t \; \text{minutes} \cdot \frac{450 \; \text{ft}}{1.0 \; \text{minutes}} \amp = t \; \text{minutes} \cdot \frac{2500 \; \text{ft}}{t \; \text{minutes}}.\\ t \cdot 450 \; \text{ft} \amp = 2500 \; \text{ft}.\\ \frac{t \cdot 450 \; \text{ft}}{450 \; \text{ft}} \amp = \frac{2500 \; \text{ft}}{450 \; \text{ft}}.\\ t \amp = \frac{2500}{450}\\ t \amp \approx 5.5 \text{ minutes}. \end{aligned}

statement.p: For a particular cheesecake recipe there is 15\bar{0} g of eggs and 150\bar{0} g of cream cheese. Suppose you have 35\bar{0} g of eggs and 340\bar{0} g of cream cheese. How much of the egg and cream cheese can you use?
Egg:
Cream cheese:

solution.p: The egg to cream cheese must be in a 1/10 ratio. We can check what the ratio of ingredients we have is.
Because this is more than 1/10=0.1 we have more egg than we can use. Thus we will set up the 1/10 ratio using all of the cream cheese.
We can use 340 of the 350 grams of egg.

statement.p: Suppose that as dry air rose it dropped in temperature in a linear fashion. If the temperature was measured at 1000 ft MSL as 21^\circ C and at 3000 ft MSL as 17^\circ C, what is the rate of change of temperature with respect to altitude?
What does this imply the temperature is at 0 ft MSL?

solution.p: The slope can be calculated as
Alternately because the temperature drops as the air rises, the temperature at a lower altitude (0 is lower than 1000) will be higher by 2 degrees. So the temperature is 21+2=23\text{.}

statement.p: Suppose we want 20.0 oz of 70.0% alcohol solution. How much water should we add? How much solution will we have?

solution.p: This is a percent problem with the total alcohol unchanged ((0.91)16=14.56) and adding only some amount w of water. Thus we setup
Thus we end up with 16+4.9=20.9 oz of the new solution.
We can confirm this work by calculating the percent water. The percent alcohol is
which is 70%.

If they start on Monday and work only weekdays, on what day of the week will they finish?
What is the greatest possible error if 8120 was rounded to the nearest ten?

solution.p: This could be any number from 8115 to 8124. Thus the greatest possible error is 5.

It is a percent
Increase
Decrease
of

statement.p: Atenolol has a half life of 6-7 hours depending on patient factors. For this problem use a half life of 6 hours. Suppose Victor is prescribed 5\bar{0} mg/day. If Victor takes his first 50 mg pill Monday morning, how much is still in his blood Tuesday morning at the same time?
Graph the amount of atenolol in his blood for the first day.

solution.p: A day is 24 hours so there are 24/6=4 times that the amount of the drug in the body will be reduced by half. Because the initial amount was 5\bar{0} mg the amount the next day is

Precision should be at least four decimal places.
What is the greatest possible error if 934\bar{0}00\text{?}

solution.p: The smallest accurate digit is the hundreds position as indicated by the bar. Thus the number could be anything from 933950-934049. Thus the greatest possible error is 50.

Consider a D which has frequency 293.66 Hz
What is the period?
What is the wavelength?

solution.p: Because we know the frequency we can directly calculate the period.

For the wavelength we need to recall the speed of sound is 1116 feet/second. Now we can use the fact that Hz is cycles per second to convert frequency (cycles per second) to wavelength (feet per cycle).

statement.p: Calculate the voltage if the current is I=3 \text{ amps}\text{,} R=4 \Omega\text{?}

solution.p: Using V=IR\text{:} V = 3 \cdot 4 = 12 volts.

statement.p: Calculate new pressure (P_2) if P_1=101.3\text{,} V_1=0.250\text{,} T_1=11.3\text{,} and V_2=0.250\text{,} T_2=14.5\text{?}
Calculate new volume (V_2) if P_1=101.3\text{,} V_1=0.250\text{,} T_1=11.3\text{,} and P_2=98.7\text{,} T_2=14.5\text{?}
In another class there are 78 students and 44 percent are female. What percent of the students are female?

solution.p: A percent is the ratio of part (44 female) to whole (78 total). So this is \frac{44}{78} \approx 0.56\text{.} This is 56 hundreths, so it is 56%

statement.p: Find the number of millilitres of alcohol needed to prepare 150 mL of solution that is 5% alcohol.

solution.p: We need to know what 5% of 150 mL is: 0.05 \cdot 150 = 7.5\text{.}
